intro: Thrixspermum phyllorhizum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of velvety, waxy leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is well-known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Thrixspermum phyllorhizum is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal.
